question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What league did Brett LeFlem compete in in 2018?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

**Breaking News: New Hampshire Native Brett LeFlem Shines in NCAA Division I Men's Basketball**

In a remarkable display of athletic prowess, Brett LeFlem, a talented college basketball player from New Hampshire, has made a name for himself in the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league. From 1997 to 2001, LeFlem took to the court, showcasing his skills and dedication to the sport. According to NCAA records, LeFlem was an active participant in the Division I men's basketball league during his college years, competing against top-tier teams and athletes from across the country. "Brett was an exceptional player, known for his agility and sharp shooting skills," said John Smith, LeFlem's former coach at the University of New Hampshire. "He was a valuable asset to our team, and we're proud to have had him represent our institution in the NCAA." Data from the NCAA reveals that during LeFlem's playing career, he averaged 12.5 points per game, with a impressive 42% three-point shooting average. His impressive stats earned him recognition as one of the top players in the America East Conference. "Brett's work ethic and passion for the game were contagious," said teammate and friend, Michael Johnson. "He pushed us all to be better, and his leadership on and off the court was instrumental in our team's success." The NCAA Division I men's basketball league is comprised of 358 colleges and universities, with over 5,000 student-athletes participating each year. To be part of this elite group, athletes must meet rigorous academic and athletic standards, making LeFlem's achievement all the more impressive. In conclusion, the evidence is clear: Brett LeFlem, a talented college basketball player from New Hampshire, did indeed play in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league from 1997 to 2001. His impressive stats, recognition from coaches and teammates, and participation in one of the most competitive college sports leagues in the country all validate this claim.
content.source_2: It's June 2036, and the world is a vastly different place. Climate change has been mitigated, and sustainable energy sources have become the norm. Virtual reality has advanced to the point where people can experience anything they desire from the comfort of their own homes. But amidst all the progress, one thing remains constant - the thrill of live sports. Brett LeFlem, a former college basketball star from New Hampshire, has defied all odds to become a professional hockey player in the National Hockey League. It's a feat that would have been unimaginable just a few decades prior, but advancements in sports medicine and training have made it possible for athletes to switch disciplines and excel. As Brett steps onto the ice, the crowd erupts in cheers. He's a fan favorite, known for his lightning-quick reflexes and razor-sharp instincts. The arena is a marvel of modern technology, with augmented reality displays and real-time analytics projected onto the ice. The game is a fusion of physicality and technology, with players wearing advanced exosuits that enhance their strength and agility. Brett's team, the New England Navigators, is facing off against their arch-rivals, the Toronto Titans. The stakes are high, with the winner securing a spot in the playoffs. The tension is palpable as the puck drops, and the game is underway. As the clock ticks down, Brett finds himself in the midst of a frenetic pace. He dodges and weaves through defenders, his exosuit amplifying his movements. The crowd is on its feet, chanting his name as he breaks away from the pack. In a stunning display of athleticism, Brett scores a hat-trick, securing the win for the Navigators. The arena erupts in a frenzy of color and sound, as the team celebrates their victory. As Brett skates off the ice, he's mobbed by his teammates and coaches. He's a true pioneer, a trailblazer in a sport that was once thought to be the exclusive domain of those who had dedicated their lives to it from a young age. But Brett's determination and perseverance have paid off, and he's living proof that with hard work and dedication, anything is possible. As he makes his way to the locker room, Brett can't help but think about the journey that brought him to this moment. From the hardwood courts of New Hampshire to the frozen tundra of the NHL, it's been a wild ride.
